parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: (a) I make, manufacture, construct, (b) I do, act, cause. Apparently a prolonged form of an obsolete primary; to make or do.
Upright, straight, direct. Probably from the base of oros; right, i.e. erect, or level or direct.
The track of a wheel, a path. From trochos; a track, i.e. a course of conduct.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
The foot. A primary word; a 'foot'.
In order that, so that. Probably from the same as the former part of heautou; in order that.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Lame, deprived of a foot, limping. Apparently a primary word; 'halt', i.e. Limping.
Not, lest. A primary particle of qualified negation; not, lest; also (whereas ou expects an affirmative one) whether.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From ek and the base of trope; to deflect, i.e. Turn away.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.
More, rather. Neuter of the comparative of the same as malista; more) or rather.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To heal, generally of the physical, sometimes of spiritual, disease. Middle voice of apparently a primary verb; to cure.
